issue.title: Avoid ThreadLocals to be more loom friendly

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
The current behaviour for the pooled buffer allocation path (on Netty 4.1, but on 5 is similar) include 2 loom unfriendly ops:
- in order to NOT use a cache, we still use a ThreadLocal operation -> https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/b61d7d40f40e3a797e8a60cd567f849a9799c771/buffer/src/main/java/io/netty/buffer/PooledByteBufAllocator.java#L537
- Recyclers uses thread local regardless the previous decision 

I see 2 fixes here:
- being able to determine if a thread shouldn't use any  cache without any thread local method (and sadly checking if current thread is a "used" event loop thread will still use another thread local ops :"/ )
- `PoolThreadCache(heapArena, directArena, 0, 0, 0, 0)` should be a singleton (using a specialized children, if possible) for v threads
- recyclers shouldn't be used with v threads for the same problem

The last is a problem we have right now as well with non-virtual and non-event loop threads as well (nudge nudge @chrisvest ): non event loop threads shouldn't use recycler(s) in the form of `ThreadLocal::get` ops or they will end up creating unecessary objects again.

issue.title: Using ReentrantLock(s) on allocator can cause deadlocks using Virtual Threads

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Although this sound very hypothetical (because it makes use of a "novel" way to marry event loops and virtual threads), let's assume that:
- a Netty event loop thread is used **as a single threaded carrier thread capable to run continuations/virtual threads**
- The virtual threads "confined" to the Netty event loop are already correctly interacting with the existing allocator's `ThreadLocal`s (more on this at https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/13191)

What can happen now (after my, sigh :"( changes to fix https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/12621) is:
1. event loop 1 run all tasks, including virtual thread A
2. A is now "mounted" on 1 and require to allocate a pooled buffer, hitting a specific arena's lock L
3. another event loop 2 has been already able to acquire L and is holding it
4. A is virtually parked and will end up in the wait queue of the reentrant lock of L
5. event loop 1 can now execute other tasks, including I/O ones and try to allocate, hitting the same arena's lock L
6. event loop 1 is parked as well, ending up in the same wait queue of L, but given that's a platform thread, is sleeping, awaiting event loop 2 to release the lock L
7. event loop 2 can release the lock L, BUT (so unfortunate!!!) the lock pick A to be unparked
8. unparking a v thread means submitting to its (carrier) executor a task, to resume it BUT event loop 1 is parked (for real) awaiting (forever), that A will resume and try acquire the lock L

The easier way to avoid this is to always consider parking dependencies as a platform operation i.e. without involving virtual parking, that CAN exploit the unexpected implicit dependency/order between the virtual thread A and its carrier event loop 1.
This can be done by reverting reentrant locks with `synchronized`.
